intro: Tabernaemontana peschiera, commonly known as the Peschiera starflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tabernaemontana peschiera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
